I will continue to work with my House @FinancialCmte colleagues to monitor and evaluate financial sanctions and consider how to best design and enforce maximum pressure on the Iranian regime.

Pursuing a U.S. strategy of maximum pressure has proven to be successful in cracking down on terrorist activities funded by Iran. Ending waivers for countries to import Iranian oil will block millions of dollars from being funneled to the world’s leading state sponsor of terror. https://twitter.com/SecPompeo/status/1120308601913073666 …

Want to know the secret to increasing prosperity in our local Arkansas communities? The answer... is education. This past week, I met with Arkansas education leaders to discuss how we can better prepare our students for tomorrow's workforce. Learn more:  https://bit.ly/2Ds65jr
The terrorist attacks in Sri Lanka are that much more horrific falling on Easter Sunday, the holiest of days. Urging prayers of peace to the victims and their families.
I’m proud to work with my House and Senate colleagues to ensure that minority WWI veterans are honored with the recognition they deserve. https://twitter.com/politico/status/1118834073621889025 …

Many minority service members during WWI were denied medals they earned because of discrimination. To correct this injustice, I introduced the WWI Valor Medals Review Act to ensure all who served are honored with the recognition they deserve. Read more:  https://bit.ly/2ZkbyC5  pic.twitter.com/cCvG2RvefT

On National Former #POW Recognition Day, we honor Arkansas POW’s like Sgt. George Bennett. After 179 days as a POW in Vietnam, and his 3rd attempted escape, he was executed by his captors. I am proud to have helped name the Perryville Post Office in memory of this Arkansas hero. pic.twitter.com/WNysaq4unx
